text:
Hello guys, I have a nice challenge for you! :slightly_smiling_face:

*Scenario:* I have a list of deals with contacts and line items associated, which have been imported through an integration. Each contact has an External ID, which will be added to each line items (of the deals associated) that the contact owns. So, for example, in a deal with 3 contacts and 3 line items, each line item will have the External ID of one of the contacts, depending if he actually owns the product or not.

*Question:* How can we have a list of contacts who own a particular product?
My idea was to create a workflow that takes all the External IDs of the line items from a particular product, and create a list of contacts who has those External IDs, but without Custom Code is quite impossible (we donâ€™t have Operational Hub Professional). Anyone has a different solution?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
where can I ask question about a custom code
Custom code in relation to what, <@U06477CRH4H>?

In relation to a workflow. I have 12h time format in a property in a want to create the same property in 24h format and im doing it through a workflow. The code works but i keep receiving this error and maybe someone can help me to fix it.
